channel.title: Advanced GWT Components - Project News
channel.description: This RSS feed contains information about latest project changes and released versions.

item.title: Advanced GWT Components 1.5.0 Released
item.description:
The new version of the popular GWT library has been released on this week.

Release includes sevearal bug fixes and totally reworked rendering for widgets with a drop down list (ComboBox and SuggestionBox).

Now both components allow configuring following rendering options:

  • number of items displayed by default
  • index of the first item in the displayed list
  • lazy rendering that draws items on list scroll

The new version is available for download. Additional information about the library and docs can be found on the offical site of the project.
item.author: Sergey Skladchikov

item.title: Advanced GWT Components 1.4.9 Released
item.description:
Beta version of the next library release has been published.

Some critical bug fixes were included as well as new features like data model events support in text and button components.

This feature is a part of the main guide of MVP architecture approach and the next step to pure MVP solution.

The demo application was recompiled under GWT 1.7.1 and available by this link: http://advanced-gwt.sourceforge.net/demo
item.author: Sergey Skladchikov

item.title: Advanced GWT Components 1.4.8 Released
item.description:
The new version of the library has been released on this week.

Build 1.4.8 include numerous bug fixes related to incorrect wokr of the TreeGrid and TreeGridDataModel.

Another important change is keyboard events support for Text & Button components: ComboBox and SuggestionBox. Now using the arrow keys, enter, and escape buttons you can select a preferable item from the drop down lists.

See more details: http://advanced-gwt.sourceforge.net/faq/combo-box-faq.html#does_support_keyboard

The demo application was recompiled under GWT 1.7 and available by this link: http://advanced-gwt.sourceforge.net/demo
item.author: Sergey Skladchikov

item.title: Advanced GWT Components 1.4.7 Released
item.description:
The new version of library has been released on this week.

This build includes:

1. Multiple row selection mode support. Now users can select several rows in a grid and apply any available operations using the toolbar.

2. Data model events listening. In this version complete MVP approach was finished. Listening to data models component views can apply changes and it doesn't require developer efforts anymore.

3. Numerous bug fixes and improvements were done in order to satisfy developer who is interested in the library. Advanced GWT Components became better and works faster.

Download the library right now to make your web application much better.

item.title: Advanced GWT Components 1.4.6 Released
item.description:
The new version of library has been released.

This revision includes:

1. Update demo application. Now it displays the source code of showcases. This approach simplifies understanding of API.

2. Basic borders API and AdvancedTabPanel were implemented.

3. Numerous bug fixes and improvements were done by users requets posted into the support forum or a bag tracking system.

item.title: Advanced GWT Components Tutorial Created
item.description:
The new project tutorial was created on the last week.

Now it much simpler to use the library and this document gives some additional explanation regarding architecture and core API.

Visit the tutorial page to know more about it: http://advanced-gwt.sourceforge.net/tutorial/index.html

item.title: Demo application has been recompiled with GWT 1.5.3
item.description:
The demo application has been recompiled. Now it's absolutely obvious that Advanced GWT Components is 100% compatible with latest GWT versions and doesn't cause any troubles.
Open live demo page to make sure it works.

item.title: Advanced GWT Components 1.4.5 Released
item.description:
The new version of library has been released.

This revision includes:

1. Improvements in scrolling / column resizing features. Now your web application will look like desktop one.

2. Default theme was reworked to exclude ugly yellow colors

3. Project site was totally reworked to make it more comfortable for getting support and technical information about the library. Visit us at http://advanced-gwt.sourceforge.net to know more.

Advanced GWT Components library is absolutely free and availbale for downloads right now.
